sen.j: 庭田家（にわたけ）は宇多源氏の流れを引く源氏堂上源氏。
sen.e: The house of Niwata, one of the houses of Dojo, was descended from the Uda-Genji (Minamoto) clan.
sen.cmt: 「源氏堂上源氏」とありますが、意味がおかしいのでＷｉｋｉｐｅｄｉａの本文をあたったところ、「流れを引く堂上家」でしたのでそのように訳出しました。
sen.e: The house of Niwata, one of the houses of Dojo, was descended from the Uda-Genji (Minamoto) clan.
The Niwata family, one of the clans of Dojo, was descended from the Uda-Genji (Minamoto) clan.

sen.j: 左大臣源雅信の子孫庭田経資（位階・中納言）（1241年 - 没年不明）を祖とする。
sen.e: The family was established by Tsunesuke NIWATA (Court Rank, Deputy Chief Councillor of State, 1241- date of death unknown) who was a descendant of MINAMOTO no Masanobu of the Minister of the Left.
The family was established by Tsunesuke NIWATA (Court Rank, Deputy Chief Councillor of State, 1241- date of death unknown) who was a descendant of MINAMOTO no Masanobu, Minister of the Left.
sen.cmt: Took out "of the" before "minister of the left".
sen.e: The family was established by Tsunesuke NIWATA (Court Rank, Deputy Chief Councillor of State, 1241- date of death unknown) who was a descendant of MINAMOTO no Masanobu, Minister of the Left.

sen.j: 綾小路家の祖綾小路信有（位階・権中納言）（1269年 - 1324年）は弟に当たる。
sen.e: Nobuari AYANOKOJI (Court Rank, Junior Deputy Chief Councillor of State, 1269-1324), the founder of the house of Ayanokoji, was Tsunesuke's younger brother.
Nobuari AYANOKOJI (Court Rank, Junior Deputy Chief Councillor of State, 1269-1324), the founder of the house of Ayanokoji, was Tsunesuke's younger brother.
Nobuari AYANOKOJI (Court Rank, Junior Deputy Chief Councillor of State, 1269 - 1324), the founder of the Ayanokoji family, was Tsunesuke's younger brother.
sen.cmt: ハイフンの前後にスペースhouse of→family

sen.e: The family was ranked as "Urinke," a type of family status of the Court nobles.
The family was ranked as "Urinke," a type of family status in the Court nobility.
sen.cmt: Changed "of the court nobles" to "in the court nobility"
sen.e: The family was ranked as "Urinke," a type of family status in the Court nobility.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代末期から南北朝時代 (日本)の庭田重資（1306年 - 1389年）以降、権大納言を極官とする。
sen.e: The top rank the family could attain was the Junior Chief Councillor of State after the time of Shigesuke NIWATA (1306-1389)from the late Kamakura period to the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

From the time of Shigesuke NIWATA (1306-1389) onwards, beween late Kamakura period and the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), the top rank attained by the family was the Junior Chief Councillor of State.
sen.cmt: 以降 includeds the time of Shigusuke. I changed the translation accordingly.
sen.e: From the time of Shigesuke NIWATA (1306 - 1389) onwards, between late Kamakura period and the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), the top rank attained by the family was the Junior Chief Councillor of State.
sen.cmt: ハイフンの前後にスペーススペル

sen.j: 代々の庭田家の女子は皇室及び伏見宮家に仕え、親王を産むこととなる。
sen.e: The females of the house of Niwata served the Imperial Family and the house of Fushimi-no-miya for generations, and bored Imperial princes.
The females of the house of Niwata served the Imperial Family and the house of Fushimi-no-miya for generations, and bore Imperial princes.
The females of the Niwata family served the Imperial Family and the house of Fushimi no miya for generations, and bore Imperial princes.

sen.j: ちなみに室町時代の後花園天皇及び後柏原天皇の生母は庭田家の出身である。
sen.e: In fact, the real mothers of Emperor Gohanazono and Emperor Gokashiwabara in the Muromachi period came from the house of Niwata.
In fact, the real mothers of Emperor Gohanazono and Emperor Gokashiwabara in the Muromachi period came from the house of Niwata.
In fact, the real mothers of the Emperor Gohanazono and the Emperor Gokashiwabara in the Muromachi period came from the Niwata family.
sen.cmt: 全角を半角にhouse of→familyスペース削除"the" を挿入しました。

sen.j: また、戦国時代_(日本)には本願寺顕如の生母を出した事から、本願寺（一向一揆）と諸大名の仲介役を行った事がある。
sen.e: During the Warring States period (Japan), the family intermediated between the Hongan-ji Temple (Ikko-Ikki, an uprising of Ikko sect followers) and other feudal lords because the real mother of Kennyo HONGANJI came from the house of Niwata.

During the Warring States period (Japan), the family intermediated between the Hongan-ji Temple (Ikko-Ikki, a group of Ikko sect followers) and other feudal lords because the real mother of Kennyo HONGANJI had come from the house of Niwata.

During the Warring States period (Japan), the family intermediated between the Hongan-ji Temple (Ikko-Ikki, a group of Ikko sect followers) and other feudal lords because the real mother of Kennyo HONGANJI had come from the Niwata family.

sen.j: 江戸時代には大原家が分かれ出た。
sen.e: The family established a branch family, the house of Ohara, in the Edo period.
The family established a branch family, the house of Ohara, in the Edo period.
The family established a branch family, the Ohara family, in the Edo period.
The house business: Ancient Shinto music and dancing.
The house business was Ancient Shinto music and dancing.
The house business was Ancient Shinto music and dancing.
The hereditary stipend was 350 koku in the Edo period.
In the Edo period, the hereditary stipend was 350 koku.
sen.cmt: I think it is better to have the time first here.
sen.e: In the Edo period, the hereditary stipend was 350 koku.
After the Meiji period, the family was given the title of count.
From Meiji period onwards, the family held the title of count.
sen.cmt: 以降 indicates that the Meiji period is included.
sen.e: From the Meiji period onwards, the family held the title of count.
